HR Insights [en] Company [has_children] [en] About Us [child] [en] Partners [child] [en] Career [child] [en] FAQ [child] [en] Contact [en] Login [en] DE EN ONLINE DEMO BUCHEN Die HR Software für Unternehmensgestalter Ihr Copilot im HR Team Mit staffboard gestalten Sie Ihr Personalwesen nach den Bedürfnissen Ihrer Organisation. Sie schaffen mehr Zeit und Transparenz für Ihr Team, in einer modernen HR Software. JETZT KOSTENLOS TESTEN Good Bye, Papier Chaos! Herzlich Willkommen, Digitale Personalakte! Mit Hilfe der digitalen Mitarbeiterverwaltung können Sie alle Informationen über Ihre Mitarbeiter übersichtlich an einem Ort abspeichern. Suchen Sie mühsam nach Arbeitsverträgen, Attesten oder sonstigen Mitarbeiterdokumenten und verlieren dadurch wertvolle Zeit? Mit unserer Digitalen Personalakte finden Sie alles auf einen Blick im Mitarbeiterprofil. Dank des Employee Self Service (ESS) können zahlreiche Daten eigenständig von den Mitarbeitern gepflegt werden. So sparen Sie Zeit, Geld und natürlich Nerven für andere wichtige Themen. Bewerbermanagement leicht gemacht Mit unserem übersichtlichen Recruiting Modul verlieren Sie nie mehr einen Bewerber aus den Augen. Durch intuitives Drag & Drop können Sie ihre Bewerber schnell durch die Phasen Ihres individuellen Bewerbungsprozesses leiten. Eingangsbestätigungen werden automatisiert versendet und personalisierte Terminvereinbarungen oder Absagen sind mit einem Klick möglich. Viele Funktionen wie das Abgeben von Bewertungen für Bewerber, schreiben von Kommentaren und die Einbindung weiterer Teammitglieder sind problemlos möglich. STAFFBOARD 30 TAGE KOSTENLOS TESTEN! JETZT ANMELDEN Eine kleine Auswahl unserer treuen Kunden. "Wir sind an dem Punkt, an dem wir ohne dieses Tool schlicht nicht arbeiten könnten." Jakob Schoroth (Reparando GmbH) Managing Director ✔️ staffboard wurde in Deutschland gegründet und hat seinen Hauptsitz in München. ✔️ Die Daten werden ausschließlich in Deutschland verarbeitet und verschlüsselt gespeichert. ✔️ Regelmäßige Updates und Backups sorgen für größtmögliche Sicherheit. Zudem liegen ISO-Zertifizierungen der Hosting Provider vor. ✔️ Die staffboard HR Software und die Daten werden in Rechenzentren in Deutschland gehostet. ✔️ Unternehmen mit dem Siegel hinterlegen beim BITMi e.V. den Standard ihrer Maßnahmen bzgl. Datenschutz. ✔️ Für den Vertrag mit den Hosting Provider gilt ausschließlich deutsches Recht, insbesondere das deutsche Datenschutzrecht, das BGB und das HGB. ✔️ Wir unterliegen der Kontrolle eines externen und unabhängigen Datenschutzbeauftragten. ✔️ Eine AV-Vereinbarung mit jedem Kunden gewährleistet Datenschutz und Datensicherheit. ✔️ Unsere Mitarbeiter sind im Umgang mit sensiblen, personenbezogenen Daten geschult und erhalten regelmäßige Unterweisungen. ✔️ 100% Service: Bei Fragen zum Produkt finden Sie stets einen deutschsprachigen Ansprechpartner. ✔️ 100% Qualität: Die in Deutschland designte staffboard HR Software wird auch in Deutschland getestet. ✔️ 100% Zukunft: Die staffboard HR Software ist investitionssicher und wird kontinuierlich weiterentwickelt und aktualisiert. Melden Sie sich für unseren Newsletter an, um regelmäßig über neue Funktionen und Produkt Updates informiert zu werden. Registrien Email sent! Check your inbox to complete your signup. Digitalisieren Sie Ihre HR Prozesse Unsere staffboard HR Software automatisiert und vereinfacht alle wesentlichen Personalprozesse. Dashboard Recruiting (ATS) Digitale Personalakte Abwesenheitsmanagement Feedback & Performance Learning Zeiterfassung Lohnabrechnung Organigramm Reports Kostenlos & unverbindlich Tage testen * Ich akzeptiere die Datenschutzbestimmungen und die AGB . Jetzt anmelden Benutzerfreundlich Unser intuitives Design ermöglicht eine steile Lernkurve ohne große Einarbeitung. Flexibel Jedes Unternehmen ist anders – und das wissen wir. Darum lässt sich staffboard an Ihre Anforderungen anpassen. Online Greifen Sie von überall mit einer verschlüsselten Verbindung auf staffboard zu. SUPPORT Allgemeine Fragen zum Produkt? 089 - 1250 1458 contact@staffboard.de Für technischen Support innerhalb der Software steht Ihnen ein Ticketsystem zur Verfügung. Is this the ever-popular Punta Gorda Pub Crawl’s last hurrah? - Charlotte County Florida Weekly Search for: Search Submit ▼ Log In Gift Subscriptions Charlotte County Florida Weekly Home News Business A&E Events Real Estate At Home Special Sections Marketplace Print Editions Business Directory Archives Choose Your Community Bonita Springs Charlotte County Fort Myers Key West Naples Palm Beach Florida Weekly Home About Us Advertising Solutions Newsstand Locations Subscribe Frequently Asked Questions Careers Contact Us Report Website Accessibility Problems Pay Your Advertising Invoice Obituaries Place An Obituary Public Notices View Place Log In Privacy Policy Florida Weekly Home Fort Myers Bonita Springs Charlotte County Key West Naples Palm Beach Wednesday, September 10, 2025 Search Newsletter Events Photos Classifieds Subscribe Marketplace Home News Top News Healthy Living Opinion Pet Tales Business Business In The Know Business News Networking The Motley Fool A&E Arts and Entertainment News Society What to Do, Where to Go Cuisine Events Add Event Real Estate Special Sections Arts Preview – Act I Arts Preview – Act II At Home Best of 2025 Best of 1/2 2025 Businesses of Distinction Destination Guide Healthy Body How-To Guide Health Trends Hurricane Guide Newcomers Guide Staycations & Getaways 2024 Breast Cancer 2024 Veterans 2025 Pet Obituaries Place An Obituary Public Notices Place View Is this the ever-popular Punta Gorda Pub Crawl’s last hurrah? By oht_editor on February 15, 2024 BY BOB MASSEY bmassey@floridaweekly.com Nick Berry and Mike Colgan lead the charge from the Ice House Pub to start Punta Gorda Pub Crawl. MIKE COLGAN / COURTESY PHOTO Yes, this year’s Punta Gorda Pub Crawl is sold out — and, yes, you should stop by anyway. Why? For two reasons. First of all, you might actually get in. “There will be tickets available on the day of,” said Mike Colgan, co-founder of the event, along with Nick Berry. “People always turn in tickets, and I hate to see them not get sold.” For ticket availability, look for the Pub Crawl tent in the staging area outside the IceHouse Pub. Second, at the heart of the event — and one of the primary reasons it was created — is the food drive to benefit the Harry Chapin Food Bank of Southwest Florida (as well as assisting other charities, such as The Homeless Coalition and the local branch of The Salvation Army). There have been 12 Pub Crawls over the past 14 years — the pandemic and Hurricane Ian knocked out two of them — but the food drive still continued during the off years. The Pub Crawl had previously been promoted solely by posters and word of mouth. In 2020, Colgan decided to invest in advertising the event in Florida Weekly. The result: The Pub Crawl broke its previous record by 2,000 pounds. Mike Colgan and Nick Berry are the organizers of the Punta Gorda Pub Crawl and food drive. MIKE COLGAN / COURTESY PHOTOS That year, the food drive collected 7,800 pounds — nearly 4 tons — of food in three hours, all donated to the Harry Chapin Food Bank of Southwest Florida, Colgan said. That record still stands. “We’ve come close to it, but we haven’t beaten that mark,” Colgan added. “We’re hoping to beat that this year.” The total collected over the 14 years is 33,000 pounds of donated food — and thousands of dollars given to charities. The public is invited to the food drive at no charge; you don’t need a Pub Crawl ticket to participate in the food donation. And there are perks for doing so. “Anybody giving food will get a raffle ticket — one per can, up to 24 cans — for a chance to win a seven-day cruise for two, leaving out of Miami with two stops in Mexico, one stop in Honduras, and a stop in the Bahamas. It is transferable, you can update the cabin, update the sailing dates,” Colgan said. Workers load food donated to the Harry Chapin Food Bank, one of three local charities that benefit from the Punta Gorda Pub Crawl. A raffle ticket also pays your admission to live music. Perennial favorite Brigid’s Cross, which hails from Cleveland, Ohio, will perform from 11 a.m. to 1:15 p.m. At 1:30 p.m., all Pub Crawl participants will line up into six color-coded groups, each with a leader. As the whistled strains of the iconic “Colonel Bogey March” begin playing, Colgan and Berry will lead the parade of revelers, setting them off to their respective participating bars and restaurants. “They will be playing Follow the Leader for six hours,” Colgan said. To promote safety, designated drivers will be given free soft drinks at all venues. “We encourage everyone to visit the website, www.puntagordapubcrawl.com ,” Colgan said. “You’ll find a tip sheet, information, pictures and videos from years past, and a flyer for the food drive that people can post in different establishments. “We’re expecting great weather. We’ve been very blessed in this event over the years. One year it was predicted we’d have a 70% chance of rain — and the Lord didn’t allow it to rain until 7 o’clock that night. Everybody brought umbrellas and the rain stayed away.” The final stop — where everyone will meet — is the Sunloft Center, 201 W. Marion Ave., which houses Leroy’s Southern Kitchen & Bar — and which, coincidentally, will be providing bar services at the terminus. At 8:30 p.m., the winning ticket will be draw for the raffle, and the Pub Crawl will come to an end. Will there be another Pub Crawl next year? Maybe, maybe not. As difficult as it is to imagine Punta Gorda without its annual signature Pub Crawl — some participants come from out of state and even plan their vacations around the event, Colgan noted — this year is the last hurrah for Colgan and Berry. They hope someone will take up the reins and purchase the event from them. “It is a legitimate not-for-profit corporation in the state, and it is priced to sell,” Colgan said. “A buyer could recoup their investment within five years, by our calculations.” In short, they would eventually make money — and also make a lot of people happy while doing it. Any takers? ¦ Leave a Reply Cancel reply Your email address will not be published. PG Pub Crawl is sold out, but still come for the food drive - Charlotte County Florida Weekly Search for: Search Submit ▼ Log In Gift Subscriptions Charlotte County Florida Weekly Home News Business A&E Events Real Estate At Home Special Sections Marketplace Print Editions Business Directory Archives Choose Your Community Bonita Springs Charlotte County Fort Myers Key West Naples Palm Beach Florida Weekly Home About Us Advertising Solutions Newsstand Locations Subscribe Frequently Asked Questions Careers Contact Us Report Website Accessibility Problems Pay Your Advertising Invoice Obituaries Place An Obituary Public Notices View Place Log In Privacy Policy Florida Weekly Home Fort Myers Bonita Springs Charlotte County Key West Naples Palm Beach Wednesday, September 10, 2025 Search Newsletter Events Photos Classifieds Subscribe Marketplace Home News Top News Healthy Living Opinion Pet Tales Business Business In The Know Business News Networking The Motley Fool A&E Arts and Entertainment News Society What to Do, Where to Go Cuisine Events Add Event Real Estate Special Sections Arts Preview – Act I Arts Preview – Act II At Home Best of 2025 Best of 1/2 2025 Businesses of Distinction Destination Guide Healthy Body How-To Guide Health Trends Hurricane Guide Newcomers Guide Staycations & Getaways 2024 Breast Cancer 2024 Veterans 2025 Pet Obituaries Place An Obituary Public Notices Place View PG Pub Crawl is sold out, but still come for the food drive By Staff on February 17, 2022 BY BOB MASSEY bmassey@floridaweekly.com Punta Gorda Pub Crawl founders Mike Colgan and Nick Berry emphasize that the event is as much about the charity as it is the fun of tavern hopping and live music. COURTESY PHOTOS Mike Colgan was worried about attendance when he opened up the sale of tickets for the 11th annual Punta Gorda Pub Crawl this year. He needn’t have worried. Mr. Colgan, who co-founded the event with Nick Berry, had to cancel out last year due to the pandemic. But he could have just read the telling sign if he wanted to prognosticate this year’s results: In 2021, several people descended on Punta Gorda to have their own, scaled-down version of the event. They affectionately referred to it as year 10.5. Not only that, “Last year, we raised more than $1,500 for several of our charities by having a link on our website,” Mr. Colgan reported. “People donated the money they would have spent that year.” This year, the Punta Gorda Pub Crawl sold out in just 16 days. If you’re sad about not getting in yourself, don’t give up hope just yet. “There are always tickets available day-of because people show up with unused tickets,” Mr. Colgan said. “It’s $35 day-of, limited availability. But the whole town’s invited for the food drive.” The Punta Gorda Pub Crawl is not just a mass of people meandering from bar to bar — it is a highly organized event in which participants are separated into teams by color, and each team takes turns at the different venues. There’s live music, raffles, giveaways and more. And while hitting the bars on the route may be the heart of the Pub Crawl, the food drive, along with donations to local charities, is it’s soul. In 2020, Mr. Colgan tried something new. Instead of limiting promotion to posters and word of mouth, he invested in advertising the event in Florida Weekly. The result: The Pub Crawl broke its previous record by 2,000 pounds, collecting 7,800 pounds — nearly 4 tons — of food in three hours, all donated to the Harry Chapin Food Bank of Southwest Florida. “I wish I had advertised sooner,” said Mr. Colgan (who has since become a marketing strategist for Florida Weekly). In 2020, the Punta Gorda Pub Crawl’s food drive broke its previous record by 2,000 pounds, collecting 7,800 pounds — nearly 4 tons — of food in three hours, all donated to the Harry Chapin Food Bank of Southwest Florida. COURTESY PHOTOS He and Mr. Berry are hoping to match that generous amount in 2022 during the food drive, which is scheduled from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Then, at 1:30 p.m., Mr. Cogan and Mr. Berry lead all the participants — which are capped out at 400 strong (500 proved too many one year) — to the tune of the “Colonel Bogey March” before the teams disperse to one of six assigned pubs. The Pub Crawl begins at The Ice-House Pub and ends at Hurricane Charley’s. Participating taverns in between are Downtown Gatorz, TT’s Tiki Bar, The Belgian Monk, Shorty’s, Dean’s South of the Border, and PG Social House. Teams spend about 50 minutes at each location, then walk about 10 minutes to the next one on their route. Each bar will offer a drink special to Pub Crawlers. Headlining the bands is Brigid’s Cross. “The music on the day is amazing,” Mr. Colgan said. “We have American Made playing at Belgian Monk. We have Deb and the Dynamics, from Sarasota, playing at Shorty’s. At 7 p.m. at Shorty’s, we have Champ Jaxon and his band take the stage.” Participants in the Punta Gorda Pub Crawl are organized into colored teams, with each team starting at a different venue. Here, the red team marches on in 2020. The raffle’s grand prize — sponsored by Downtown Gatorz and DoughBar Pizza Pasta — is for a three-night stay at a luxury resort in the Bahamas. “Keith Callaghan (senior director of development at Lee Health) is providing a second prize, which is round-trip airfare to Asheville, North Carolina,” Mr. Colgan added. Anyone bringing a nonperishable can of food will receive one $10 raffle ticket free (per can), up to 24 cans per person. “We’re super excited to finally getting back to doing it,” Mr. Berry said, “to giving money for some charities and giving food to other charities.” “It’s not a drinking contest,” Mr. Cogan emphasized. “Designated drivers are encouraged, and get free soft drinks all day long, and a T-shirt from our beer sponsor, Goose Island, and from our event sponsor, Suncoast Beverage. “It’s for a good time, and it’s well attended. We send tickets all over the country. There are a lot of people from Minnesota, Michigan. People plan their vacation around this. With 700 people vying for 400 tickets, it’s common for us to hear someone say, ‘Man, I’ve been trying to get a ticket to this for three years.’ The other thing we hear is, ‘I’ve been trying to make it to the end of this event — and this year, I finally did.’” ¦ One response to “PG Pub Crawl is sold out, but still come for the food drive” Suzanne Beiner says: February 17, 2022 at 9:50 am Great article! [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text disabled_on=”off|off|off” admin_label=”Red- For Our Members Only” _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#000000″ text_font_size=”16px” background_color=”#c4efdc” custom_margin=”10px||||false|false” custom_padding=”20px|25px|20px|25px|false|true” hover_enabled=”0″ border_radii=”on|8px|8px|8px|8px” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″] For Our Members Only PG Chamber Radio Show: Exclusively For PG Chamber Members. NOW BOOKING FOR MARCH! Our monthly radio show on Seaview 104.9FM during the Bob Alexander Radio Show is the first Wednesday and Thursday of each month. The process is simple. Bob will call you, set up a recording time and it’ll be done over the phone and inserted into the programming of this popular show. You get the option to record two slots or record one to air twice during the show. Bob will let you know during which hour it will air. The cost is $110 (payable to the PG Chamber, not iHeart). To register for the show, email John Wright . Only 10 businesses per month. It’s a great way to promote your business, advertise an event or show community support. [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” hover_enabled=”0″ global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″] Whitney Grace: A Letter to Broadway Encore Join us for a delightful Italian buffet dinner followed by the talented Whitney Grace’s one-woman show! Wednesday, April 5, 7-9 PM Charlotte Harbor Convention & Event Center, 75 Taylor Street, Punta Gorda. $50 per person for dinner and show A Love Letter to Broadway Encore is a one-hour one-woman follow-up to her November 2022 extravaganza. She jumps from show to show featuring high-energy classics through dance, song and story. For tickets go to https://www.chamberstaging.com/shop-chamber/ For more information, call 941.639.3720 [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” hover_enabled=”0″ sticky_enabled=”0″] Laird’s Golf Challenge Saturday, June 17 2021 Topgolf Blvd. (Just off I-75 in Fort Myers) ENTRY FEE: $100 Per Person (4-6 People per team) Includes Golf, Lunch buffet, & Festivities Cash Bar, Prizes Galore Noon-3pm Deadline to enter: Thursday, June 8 No need to lug your clubs or wear golf shoes or bring balls and tees… TopGolf supplies everything you need! For more information: Call 941.639.3720 Email tzajas@puntagorda-chamber.com for a form [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Partners in Action News” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”] Partners in Action News [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” hover_enabled=”0″ global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″] Four Points By Sheraton (Platinum) – T.T.’s Tiki Bar is exactly what you need. Come and enjoy a great meal while having a drink in your hand and toes in the sand. We have two bands making their Tiki debut this weekend. Tonight, we have Tiny Turner, a ZZ Top Tribute band, starting at 7 pm. On Saturday, we have a U2 Tribute Band taking the stage at 7 pm. Both bands are VIP events and you can purchase tickets now at ttspg.com . Please click here to see when all of your favorite bands are performing this month. It’s not too late to book your Valentine’s Day reservations in our Dockside Grill. Please click here for all of the menu details. Our new Tiki hut called Harborside Garden is now open for private events. We are currently booking weddings, rehearsal dinners, birthday parties, celebration of life, corporate events etc. It can hold up to 300 people for dinner and 500 for a reception-style get together. Please call Kelly Williamson at 941.637.6770 for more information. The following are our specials: Join us for Happy Hour in the Dockside Grill from 4-7 pm every day of the week. We offer $3 draft beer, $4 house wine and $5 premium cocktails Join us for Happy Hour at T.T.’s Tiki Bar from open to 6 pm Monday to Friday. We offer $4 drafts, $4 well cocktails and $5 house wines. The Dockside Grill serves all you can eat fish and chips every Friday for $12.95. The Dockside Grill serves Prime Rib every Saturday The Dockside Grill features a different nightly special. TIME Realty (Gold) – It’s Friday! The 7-day rolling stat for PG, PC & NP show 204 new listings,  163 new contracts, 76 new closings and 199 new price decreases. The market has picked up – if you are considering selling, I would love to talk with you! Give me a call, cell 239.699.4493, and put my 25 years of experience to work for you. Downtown Farmers Market (Gold) – Open 8 am to 1 pm Saturdays . Produce, seafood, olives, pickles, guacamole, bakeries and more! More vendors in the parking garage breezeway. Shore Point Health (Gold) – In recognition of American Heart Month, ShorePoint Health is taking the entire month of February to help people in the community learn ways to reduce their risks with the 28-Day Healthy Heart Challenge. www.ShorePointHealthCharlotte.com/heart-challenge and show your heart some love! ❤️” The Wyvern Hotel (Gold) – Valentine’s Lovers Retreat , tomorrow includes King Room, four-course dinner and roof-top breakfast for 2. $399. Reservations required. Call 941.639.7700. 101 E. Retta Esplanade, Punta Gorda. CAM Realty (Silver) – Virtual office available in Downtown Punta Gorda, $99/+tax per month. Provides your company the image of an office without the cost of dedicated office space. Contact CAM Realty: 941.833.0083. Coastal Expressions Wine Bar (Silver) – Located in the ISLES at 1133 Bal Harbor Blvd in the Plaza at Suite #1135. If you haven’t been here before, we are more than just a wine bar, we offer a unique fun experience including enjoying delicious food, wine, beer, non-alcoholic drinks, retail wine by the bottle or that unique boutique gift … plus family fun activities by day or night. Daily, (Tuesday 10 am – Saturday 9 pm) we offer Wine Tastings, Wine Flights, Wine and Food Pairings. Daily, we also serve breakfast flatbreads and mimosas, Flatbread lunch specials served with a complimentary glass of wine, beer or drink of your choice, a full dinner menu including dessert, our date night dinner special for two served with a bottle of red or white, of course our signature “Charcuterie Boards” with flavors of gourmet meats and cheeses from around the globe, our “anytime” date night special for two served with a bottle of red or white, and so much more … Visit our website at www.coastal-expressions.com to view our wine/beer and food menu, including our full “events calendar” with activities of fun things to do with your friend, spouse or when family is in town. Come check us out or give us a call at 941.214.8599. Creative Window Treatments (Silver) – We are here for your window treatments needs. Area’s only Hunter Douglas Showcase Dealer, Plantations Shutters, Blinds, Shades, Drapery and more. Call 941.637.0015. Fishermen’s Village (Silver) – February calendar of events and Sunset Beach Club February events. Luxury Romantic February Getaway at The Suites. Book today ! Punta Gorda Chocolate and Wine (Silver) – Only FIVE days until Valentine’s Day! Have you gotten that special someone their perfect gift? Let us craft you a Custom Gift Basket, Wine Basket, Chocolate Heart Box, Beer Basket and more! We will be open on Valentine’s Day from 10 am-6 pm, make it easy and pre-order NOW so all you have to do is pick it up on the way to that special someone. Punta Gorda Coffee and Tea (Silver) – Did you know that we have International Organic Coffee Beans? Come see the collection of beans freshly roasted by Black Gold Coffee Roasters. These beans are hand selected and roasted to perfection. Our beans can be ground at the store or you can take the whole beans with you and grind them at home. Military Heritage Museum (Silver in Kind) – Monday, February 13: Sweetheart Luncheon and Fashion Show, $35 per person. February Gulf Theater Happenings, click here . WENG Radio (Silver In Kind) – Chamber members can broadcast information about their business to the public. Click here for special rate. Animal Welfare League (Bronze) – we’ve got kittens, yes we do! We’ve got kittens just for you! TOMORROW, in anticipation of a spring full of kittens and expecting momma cats, we invite you to spend the day with us in celebration. There will be food, drinks, games, raffles and of course KITTENS! Visit our Kitten Shower page on our website or our Facebook Event page for more information. Contact AWL’s Marketing Manager @Elizabeth Marcino for more information. Charlotte Players (Bronze) – “Natural Woman: A Tribute to Carole King” starring Katie Pinder Brown, Monday, February 27. Natural Woman is the premier tribute to legendary singer/songwriter Carole King. Professional piano entertainer Katie Pinder Brown plays and sings live the iconic songs that defined a generation. At The Charlotte Harbor Event and Conference Center, 75 Taylor St., Punta Gorda. The Edwards Twins February 13 and 14. Back by popular demand, The Edwards Twins, direct from Las Vegas! Join us at The Charlotte Harbor Event and Conference Center for this great show. Located at 75 Taylor Street in Punta Gorda. “How The Other Half Loves,” Now through February 26. At 1182 Market Circle in Port Charlotte. March 6: Folk Legacy Trio , 7:30 pm. At The Charlotte Harbor Event and Conference Center, 75 Taylor St., Punta Gorda. For more information and tickets, go to www.charlotteplayers.org or call 941.255.1022. Gulfshore Opera (Bronze) – GO into February with community concerts, friendly social events and a full-scale opera production! “The Barber of Seville” will be performed February 19 in Estero and February 23 at the Charlotte PAC in Punta Gorda. Join the GO Divas at the Emerald Isle with “Songs of Ireland ” Touring March 8-15 PicklePlex® of Punta Gorda (Bronze) – You’re invited! Please join us for a PicklePlex® Expansion Celebration for our eight new courts on Friday, February 17, at 10:30 am. We’ll be convening outside courts 11-13 on the FSW Charlotte Campus, 2600 Airport Rd., Punta Gorda. It’s a Black/White event (come in your pickleball attire). There will be food, beverages, music and special activities. See you there! Our “Monday Night Guided Practice” (perfect for newbies) has become so popular that reservations are now necessary. You will need to sign up by 9 am Monday mornings. The first 26 registered may attend. How to sign up: Download the Team Reach app to your phone; enter Group Code: 22mongp; select the calendar to choose preferred date(s); select Yes if coming or No if not. By registering, we can also message you if we need to cancel a session. Brand new players, please email gloria.reilly@pickleplex.org for special instructions – limited to 12 players (2 courts). C.A.R.E. of Charlotte County (Support) – Love Should NOT Hurt! February has been known as the month of love, and romance. Unfortunately, not all relationships are healthy and they can result in domestic violence or sexual violence. C.A.R.E.’s 24/7 SV Hotline 941.627.6000 has trained advocates that are here to help, promote healing and give hope. Teen dating violence is an issue that that impacts everyone – not just teens – but their parents, friends and communities as well. February is National Teen Dating Violence Awareness and Prevention Month. Together, we can raise the awareness about teen dating violence and promote safe, healthy relationships. C.A.R.E.’s 24/7 HELPLINE 941.637.0404 Drug Free Punta Gorda (Support) – Thursday, February 16 DFPG Coalition Meeting , 11:30 am-1 pm. Join in person (DFPG Office at East Elem School, 27050 Fairway Drive, Punta Gorda) or by zoom. RSVPs appreciated. Frank Desquin (Support) – Did you know one of Punta Gorda’s early postmasters was a well-known Florida politician, minister and civil rights advocate? Click here to learn more. Gator Wilderness Camp School (Support) – Banquet Fundraiser, Thursday, March 9, Punta Gorda Isles Civic Association, 2001 Shreve St., Punta Gorda. Sponsor table of 8, $400. $80 individual ticket. Contact Melissa Bergey to reserve tickets or table. 941.639.7722 or email melissab.gatorcamp@gmail.com Peace River Botanical & Sculpture Gardens (Support) – Upcoming events : Tomorrow: First Annual Art & Garden Soiree , 6-9 pm. For tickets: Events and Programs | Peace River Botanical & Sculpture Gardens (peacerivergardens.org) February 14-May 14: Caribbean Colors Exhibit featuring Leoma Lovegrove. February 16: Wreath Class with Cathy Perry February 21: Garden Goddesses and Gargoyles February 26: Brunch with the Birds March 24: Mums the Word: Murder Mystery in the Gardens Punta Gorda Isles Civic Association (Support) – Introductory course in Florida Fishing is being offered at the PGI Civic Association. The instructor is local fishing guide Capt. Ralph Allen who might even reveal the locations of a few local hotspots! The course is open to the public and held on Wednesdays from 7-9 pm for six weeks beginning on February 22. Cost is $50 and advance registration recommended. Call 941.637.1655. Valerie’s House – Charlotte County (Support) – A non-profit organization that helps grieving children and families who have lost a loved one to go on to live fulfilling lives. Our vision is that no child grieves alone. Would you like to be a Valerie’s House Volunteer Facilitator ? Our next training will be in Port Charlotte on April 15-16. Please complete the volunteer application link to join us: Volunteer in SWFL — Valerie’s House (valerieshouse.org) . We will also be having our Charity Quarter Frenzy Fundraising Event on Thursday, March 9, 6 pm, 24 Twentyone Event Center, 2421 Tamiami Trail in Port Charlotte. Virginia B. Andes Volunteer Community Clinic (Support) – Raffle tickets available for a fabulous Caribbean vacation for two. Winning ticket will be drawn September 30. All proceeds aid our ability to fulfill our mission to provide quality medical and pharmaceutical care for the uninsured residents of Charlotte County. Visual Arts Center (Support) – Are you looking for something creative to do this Valentine’s Day? The Visual Arts Center is offering the perfect accompaniment to your Valentine’s Day celebration! Join us on February 14 where we will set the scene with, wine, flowers and live music from principal Viola musician, Rachel Cox. You and your sweetheart will be able to enjoy an artistic endeavor together as you decorate your own delicious cupcakes. Join us before or after dinner or make this this the main event! We welcome you to tour our art galleries while you’re here and will have our outdoor patio open for star gazing as well. Limited reservations are available, please call 941. 639.8810 to save your spot before it’s too late, $50 per couple event runs 5-7 pm Valentines at the VAC – Visual Arts Center (visualartcenter.org) [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”Member Information” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” collapsed=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row admin_label=”Member Information” _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” border_width_top=”2px” border_color_top=”#000000″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Title: Member Information” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”] Member Information [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Content: Member Information” _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” hover_enabled=”0″ global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″] HipNOTique – The boutique will soon be reopening at 111 West Marion Avenue in Punta Gorda! The pop-up store that was going to be held at the PG Chamber office today has been cancelled. Sugar Chic Boutique – Re-Grand Opening tomorrow 9 am to 6 pm, 211 West Olympia Ave., Punta Gorda. Free gift with purchase (while supplies last). Complimentary drinks at the door. Octagon Wildlife Sanctuary – Within the next two weeks, the sanctuary will reopen with guided tours. Tour guides will give the history behind the animals. Yes, it’s different from how you visited in the past but we hope you’ll enjoy it even more. Reservations will be available online soon. octagonwildlife.org Copperfish Books – Has been a fixture in the heart of Punta Gorda for more than 10 years now, and your support has sustained one of our community’s greatest treasures! We love our store, our team, our customers and the literary happenings that we’ve all created together. But it’s time for us move on to new adventures. And so we are announcing that Copperfish Books is for sale . Guardian ad Litem Foundation, 20th Judicial Circuit Inc. – The sounds of smooth jazz will again be echoing across Charlotte County at the third annual Jazz on the Harbor , a music and culinary event that benefits the Guardian ad Litem Foundation, 20th Judicial Circuit. Jazz on the Harbor will be held March 30 at Isles Yacht Club in Punta Gorda. Punta Gorda Woman’s Club – “ Bunco Game Day !” Come one, come all! This event is on Friday, February 17, noon. Open to the public. Bunco is a fun dice game you can learn on the spot. Tickets cost $20 and include lunch and prizes! Call Ellen Say 941.204.1073. Tickets must be purchased at least one week before the game. Mahjongg Tournament fundraiser, Saturday, March 4, 1-4 pm. Registration: $30 due by February 25. 118 Sullivan Street, Punta Gorda. Carmelo’s Italian Ristorante – Taste of Sicily Wine Tasting & Food Event, Tuesday, February 28, 6-9 pm. Tickets ($50) are limited and only available through RESY. Coldwell Banker/Sunstar Realty – We are having a Grand Re-Opening Celebration on Tuesday February 14 from 4-6 pm. This will give people time to go to dinner with their loved one. Light refreshments. 2825 Tamiami Trail #A, Punta Gorda. ARCHway Institute – Welcomes Matt Boggs to Board of Directors. Burnt Store Presbyterian Church – Presents: Lenten Reflections with Pastor Jaco. Each Wednesday in March (1-29), Pastor Jaco will offer thoughts on The Disciplines of Lent, sharing his beliefs about the different spiritual disciplines that are needed during this special time in the church. Loveland Center – 3rd Annual Ability 5K Run/1K Walk , March 26, 7:30 am, Laishley Park, Punta Gorda Boca Beacon – 41st Annual Rotary Fine Arts Festival , March 25-26, 10 am to 4 pm on West Dearborn St., Englewood. Gold Theatricals – Presents “Love Letters” By A.R. Gurney. We love our Chamber! Use Code: PGCHAMBER for 25% off tickets to “Love Letters” being performed at The Charlotte Performing Arts center in Punta Gorda on Friday, February 17 at 7 pm. Visit goldtheatricals.com for tickets. See why it is one of the longest-running Off-Broadway shows ever, with over 5,000 performances. Runs through February 26. Tickets $35-$50. playerscircletheater.com 239.800.3292. Sponsorships available. Sponsorship form . Charlotte Harbor Paddlers Dragon Boat Club – Be part of our team. Free intro sessions every Tuesday in February, 10 am- noon, Burnt Store Boat Ramp, 230 Burnt Store Rd., Cape Coral. Punta Gorda Historic Murals Society – Walking tours of the murals will be held every Tuesday and Thursday, now through March 30. Tours limited to 12. Click here for information. Heroes Unmasked – A non-profit organization based in Southwest Florida to benefit children with illnesses. Get involved through hospital and residential visits dressed as superheroes and philanthropy partnerships. For more information, call 941.421.6556, visit HeroesUnmasked.org or email HeroesUnmasked@yahoo,com Punta Gorda Pub Crawl – While there is no “pub crawl” in 2023, there will be a Hurricane Relief Concert and Food Drive on Saturday, February 25 from 11 am to 3 pm in the street between Nesbit and U.S. 41 NB in Punta Gorda. Punta Gorda Symphony – Two great events you won’t want to miss! Valentine’s Day at the Visual Art Center, 5-7 pm $50 per couple. Jazz on the Lawn, February 18. Boys and Girls Clubs of Charlotte County – Farm 2 Table, March 11, 5:30-9:30 pm, Laishley Park. Gourmet dinner, live entertainment, silent auction, cash bar. $125 per person. Click here for information and tickets. The Grill at 1951 – Open Mahjong Luncheon every Tuesday at 11:30 am. Call Sari at 516.343.6996. Plan a special night for Valentine’s Day. We have the perfect dinner menu and place for you to have a romantic getaway that includes a live show. Punta Gorda Boat Club – Boating in Charlotte Harbor Seminar TOMORROW, 8:30 am-noon. If you are new to Charlotte County or just want a little more info on how to safely navigate your boat within our waters, this seminar is for you. $10 per person. As a special offer, anyone who attends our seminar will be entitled to join our boat club for 20% off the initiation fee. Call 941.639.3828 and leave your name and contact number. Connect Print & Promotions, LLC. – Every February we are pleased to host and sponsor the monthly “Business Over Breakfast” as our way of saying thank you, Punta Gorda! commercial printing ✅ logo/graphic design ✅ next-level promotional swag ✅ branded apparel ✅ signs & graphics ✅ 888.978.3437 📞 info@connectpromo.net 📧 www.connectpromo.net 🖥 www.Facebook.com/connectpromo www.Instagram.com/connectprintpromotions … it’s ALWAYS about the 👊🏻 people! #connect 💚🖨💚 #fortheloveofprinting Charlotte County Imagination Library – Horses, Kids & Books, Oh My!!! HorsePower for Healing and Gilstad Literacy Foundation are collaborating on this event for families to benefit Charlotte County Imagination Library on Saturday, February 11. An affiliate of Dolly Parton’s Imagination Library and a program of Gilstad Literacy Foundation, Inc., Imagination Library has received multiple grants and donations to support the program that mails a free book to enrolled children every month from birth until age 5. All children in this age range living in Charlotte County are eligible. Enroll at www.imaginationlibrary.com or www.charlottecountyimaginationlibrary.org Nadine’s Closet – We sell custom, unique bold jewelry, hats (including vintage hats) and music boxes. Located downtown at 103 W. Marion, Punta Gorda, enter in the back and go up the stairs. A little hard to find but worth the trip! Tickets are available at the Chamber office. Smargasy Inc. – Do you need help with your Digital Marketing ? Let’s talk . Call/text 239.214.8592. TEAM Punta Gorda – Ride with us on Saturday, March 25: Pedal and Play in Paradise. A Cycling Celebration in Punta Gorda. All Dry Services of Florida Gulf Coast – Locally owned, our services include water and flood damage, mold remediation, sanitizing and deodorizing, leak detection and air fogging services. Call 703.307.7379 Yogaz – A clothing line launched on Pine Island in January 2022. Yogaz founders Barbara and Buck Pelton have relocated to Punta Gorda and the Yogaz clothing line is now available at Punta Gorda’s local markets. For more information, go to yogaz.com or yogi@yogaz.com or call 507.382.7232 ERTC Refund – We help businesses recover the payroll taxes they paid for the employees they retained during the pandemic. Basically, it’s a refund of your payroll taxes. This is a $400 billion program. We want to qualify as many businesses as possible so they can get their share of that $400 billion. It costs nothing to find out if your business qualifies for this refund. I’ll do it for you – contact me by phone or text at: 941.200.1204 or send me an email at: bob.wenz@americanercprogram.com . All I need is your name, phone number, and email address, plus the legal name of your business to see if your business qualifies. Get qualified now! Kelting Inspections – A proud partner of Hometown Heroes as we understand that we cannot thank our veterans enough for what they have done for our country. We offer discounts for veterans and active duty military! Call 941.655.8888 to schedule. St. Vincent DePaul – St. Vincent de Paul, Sacred Heart Conference – Open to serve our neighbors in need 9 am-12 noon Monday-Wednesday-Friday at 25200 Airport Rd. Walk-ins welcome, no appointment necessary. BioCide Labs – We can help with mold removal, treatment and prevention. Our main focus is the mitigation and remediation of water-damaged structures. We will walk you through the entire process over the phone and offer 15% off mold testing and remediation products when you mention the PG Chamber. Call 239.206.2854 or visit BioCideLabs.com Quick Mobile Repair – Offering a quick turnaround time for repairing cell phones, tablets, laptops, gaming consoles, etc. We are scheduling house calls for any home tech issue. Located in the Cross Trails Center, 615 Cross St. #1104. For information or to schedule appointments, please call 941.655.6681. Elie Electric Services LLC – We normally are marine based and working on our waterways, however during this time we will be working on land projects to help homeowners. 1512 Nina St., Port Charlotte. 941.763.5348. elieelectricservice.com Copy Life – We have copy machines and printers. Email tmacia@copylifeinc.com or call 404.230.8443. Edison and Ford Winter Estates – Gardening events, talks and classes offered. Click here for dates and times. Strictly Sinatra performing on tonight. Tomorrow: Celebrate Thomas Edison’s 176th birthday at10 am February 11-12: 9 am – 4 pm, Annual Spring Garden Festival . More than 60 garden vendors with exotic and native plants and trees for sale. February 14: Partnering with Captiva Spirits to offer guests a special Valentine’s Day Cocktail Chemistry Class . Visitors will learn how to make cocktails while enjoying appetizers, chocolate, music and a sunset view. February 17: Neil Zirconia, a Neil Diamond tribute entertainer will perform at the next Rhythm on the River celebration. March 26: Annual Vintage “Base Ball” Tournament at historic Terry Park in Fort Myers. First game at 10 am. Peace River Shopper – Latest Edition . Arcadia Community Local . Planting/Caring For Young Citrus Workshop UF/IFAS Extension Charlotte County will be presenting a class on “Planting and Caring for your Young Citrus” at 10 am, February 22 at Centennial Park Recreation Center, 1120 Centennial Blvd., Port Charlotte. Registered attendees will receive a ‘Sugar Belle’ citrus tree and an individual protective cover. Registration is open on Eventbrite . For information, contact Holly Bates at 941.764.4340 or Holly.Bates@CharlotteCountyFL.gov DEP Launches Hurricane Restoration Reimbursement Grant Program The online grant application portal began accepting applications on February 1. Punta Gorda Charlotte Public Library Winter Concert Sales Charlotte County Libraries and History presents the Punta Gorda Charlotte Library Winter Concert Series at the Punta Gorda Charlotte Library located at 401 Shreve St., Punta Gorda. All performances are free and start at 5 pm. No tickets or reservation required. Schedule County Tourism Development Council Now Accepting EDP Applications The Charlotte County Tourist Development Council is accepting applications for the 2023 Event Development Program (EDP). The EDP provides reimbursable funding to assist in the development of new events, occurring in low or shoulder seasons which promote Charlotte County as a tourist destination. The application is available online here . Program guidelines and application were recently revised. Applications due February 22 by emailing Brynja.Phipps@PureFlorida.com .” FEMA Hurricane Ian Update Recovery Update Resource Report [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”] Employment Opportunities [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.19.0″ _module_preset=”default” hover_enabled=”0″ global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″] Aramark Hiring Event TODAY, 8 am – 5 pm Courtyard by Marriott Fort Myers 4455 Metro Pkwy Fort Myers, FL 33916 Candidates can RSVP by texting FDOCHIRING to 63000! Or using this link: https://bit.ly/AramarkCharlotteHiringEvent Come be a part of the action! Join Charlotte Correctional Institute for an interview! We will be hiring for Corrections Kitchen Workers. Job Offers on the spot! Starting at $19/hour *$500 Sign-on Bonus* Corrections Kitchen Workers supervise inmates to ensure that meal and food items are prepared in accordance with production plans. In this role, you will train workers in methods of performing duties, as well as assign and coordinate work to promote the efficiency of operations. This person is also responsible for the sanitation of the facility and maintaining personal safety, by conforming to all standards and regulations The Grill at 1951 Hiring Multiple Positions – Start Now! Experienced Server for fine dining (or quick to learn) Front End Floor Manager Bartender Line cook Soup expert Dishwasher (full & part time) Please send Resume to: info@thegrillat1951.com Call David with questions 239.298.2827 United Way of Charlotte County Resource Development Director Please share with your connections. We work with a great team, and serve an incredible community. All we need is someone to help us obtain the resources to continue making an impact! Click here for more information: https://www.unitedwayccfl.org/…/now-hiring-resource The Yoga Sanctuary Massage Therapists While we have grown quite a bit just recently, our hope is to continue to expand our massage and wellness offerings. We are still on the search for experienced massage therapists who are looking for a long-term role in a stable and positive environment. Do you know someone? Send them our way! Click HERE . Punta Gorda Isles Civic Association Event Technician (Part-time) – This is a physical role requiring very flexible scheduling including weekends and evenings, a strong work ethic, initiative, exceptional organization, good judgement, and outstanding customer service skills. Reporting to the Executive Director, the Event Technician is responsible for: setting up and preparing the auditorium and classrooms for daily activities; setting up and breaking down the auditorium and classrooms for large special events; and staffing special events. $15-$17 per hour. Send resume to teriashley@pgica.org for consideration. Facility and Maintenance Coordinator (Full-time) Physical role requiring very flexible scheduling, strong work ethic, initiative, good judgement, and outstanding customer service skills. Reporting to the Executive Director, the Facility and Maintenance Coordinator is responsible for: setting up auditorium and classrooms for daily activities; setting up and breaking down auditorium and classrooms for large special events; staffing special events; and maintaining the cleanliness, repair and safety of the facility, equipment, and grounds. $17-$19 per hour. Includes paid vacations and holidays. Send resume to teriashley@pgica.org . Coastal Expressions Wine Bar Kitchen Help Local, fun WINE BAR in the Isles of Punta Gorda is looking to expand their kitchen staff. Are you looking for a part-time position with a limited menu for easy prepping and execution? Flexible shifts to work with your “semi-retired” lifestyle! Or are you a high school student 18+ or new college graduate? Excellent opportunity to learn culinary skills in a small kitchen environment. Limited menu allows you to hone your skills in our prep kitchen. The position will include week days and/or evenings plus Saturdays. Occasional special events. Approx. 12-20 hours/week. $12/hour plus tips. Please send resume to loris@coastal-expressions.com or call 941.214.8599 [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section
